thread.title: 'Supergirl' star addresses Jeb Bush's 'pretty hot' remarks
thread.title_full: 'Supergirl' star addresses Jeb Bush's 'pretty hot' remarks - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: 'Supergirl' star addresses Jeb Bush's 'pretty hot' remarks
text:
CBS/ Getty Images Supergirl actress Melissa Benoist broke her silence about Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush’s cringe-worthy remarks about her being ‘pretty hot.’ Supergirl can’t be stopped by a mere dose of creep-tonite.
Melissa Benoist, star of the new super hero series, “Supergirl,” leaped in a single bound into the controversy stirred up after GOP presidential contender Jeb Bush called her “pretty hot.”
Shown the cringe-worthy clip of the 62-year-old former governor of Florida, Benoist, 27, displayed a Herculean feat of diplomacy during an interview on “CBS This Morning” Monday.
“I don’t what to think about it,” she said hours before the show’s series debut on the network . “I’m glad he’s excited to watch the show.”
RELATED: 'SUPERGIRL' HAS BENOIST'S CAREER READY TO GO UP, UP AND AWAY
Bush seemed very excited by the prospect of watching the “Glee” alum on her new show during a Las Vegas campaign event last Wednesday who his favorite Marvel superhero was.
Instantly alienating any comic nerds in attendance, Bush zeroed in on a superheroine from Marvel rival DC Comics.
View More: TV News | Entertainment News | Live News | More News Videos "I saw that 'Supergirl' is on TV," Bush told his questioner . "I saw it when I was working out this morning. There's an ad promoting 'Supergirl.' She looked kind of — she looked pretty hot.
“I don’t know what channel it’s on, but I’m looking forward to that.”
Bush, though, seemed to know that he needed to change the subject faster than a speeding bullet.
“You want to get me out of my hole I just dug?,” he asked the moderator at the time.
ON A MOBILE DEVICE? WATCH THE VIDEO HERE.
